etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From German Hellandit from the name of A. T. Helland, Norwegian geologist + German -it

definitions: Any of a group of minerals found as brownish-red prismatic crystals in pegmatite veins in Norway and other localities including parts of Canada and California.

notes.text: Hellandites are hydrous borosilicates of rare earth elements and calcium, also containing aluminium, manganese, and iron, (Ca, REE, Th)₆ (Al, Fe+3) Si₄B₄O₂₂(OH)₄ (where REE = rare earth element). Crystal system: monoclinic.
